Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.imap.handler

Interface ListState

  • public interface ListState
    Operations available when responding to LIST or LSUB commands.
    Author:
    Chris Burdess
    See Also:
    AuthenticatedHandler.list(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.mailbox.MailboxStore, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, org.bluezoo.gumdrop.imap.handler.ListState), AuthenticatedHandler.lsub(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.mailbox.MailboxStore, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, org.bluezoo.gumdrop.imap.handler.ListState)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static interface  ListState.ListWriter
      Writer for list entries.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      ListState.ListWriter beginList()
      Begins a list response and returns a writer.
      void listComplete​(AuthenticatedHandler handler)
      Completes the list successfully.

    • Method Detail

      • beginList

        ListState.ListWriter beginList()
        Begins a list response and returns a writer.
        Returns:
        a writer for sending list entries

      • listEntry

        void listEntry​(java.util.Set<MailboxAttribute> attributes,
               java.lang.String delimiter,
               java.lang.String name)
        Sends a mailbox entry in the list.

        Call this for each mailbox matching the pattern, then call listComplete(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.imap.handler.AuthenticatedHandler) to complete.

        Parameters:
        attributes - the mailbox attributes
        delimiter - the hierarchy delimiter character
        name - the mailbox name

      • listComplete

        void listComplete​(AuthenticatedHandler handler)
        Completes the list successfully.
        Parameters:
        handler - continues receiving authenticated commands

      • listFailed

        void listFailed​(java.lang.String message,
                AuthenticatedHandler handler)
        List failed.
        Parameters:
        message - the error message
        handler - continues receiving authenticated commands

      • serverShuttingDown

        void serverShuttingDown()
        Server is shutting down, close gracefully.

        Sends an untagged BYE response indicating the server is shutting down and closes the connection.
